meanings.sent1: The mayor is a prominent figure in our town.
meanings.sent2: The actor became prominent after starring in a hit movie.
meanings.sent3: The prominent singer forgot the lyrics to her own song on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her prominent role in the company made her a household name.
meanings.sent5: The prominent landmark could be seen from miles away.

meanings.sent1: The prominent tree in the park provided shade for picnickers.
meanings.sent2: The prominent rock jutted out from the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The prominent shelf in the store displayed colorful items.
meanings.sent4: His prominent nose made him easily recognizable in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The prominent sign caught the attention of passersby.

meanings.sent1: The prominent red car stood out among the sea of white vehicles.
meanings.sent2: The prominent billboard on the highway advertised a new product.
meanings.sent3: The prominent hat on his head made him look like a magician.
meanings.sent4: Her prominent laugh could be heard across the room.
meanings.sent5: The prominent logo on the building identified the company instantly.
